translation.en: I'm Dan Schneider.
translation.ja: 薬剤師ダン･シュナイダー ダン･シュナイダーだ

translation.en: And I'm a pharmacist.
translation.ja: 薬剤師ダン･シュナイダー 薬剤師をしている

translation.en: I can almost remember every piece of my life.
translation.ja: すべての出来事を覚えている

translation.en: And it's kind of a crazy story.
translation.ja: 普通じゃない

translation.en: [crew member] If you keep it focused, we can go from the beginning.
translation.ja: 最初から話してください

translation.en: Okay, I can tell... I can try to tell a story, but how far do you want me to go before I stop?
translation.ja: とりあえずどこまで話せばいいかな？

translation.en: You know, what's your next question?
translation.ja: 次の質問まで？

translation.en: [crew member] You can go all the way to...
translation.ja: 全部 話してください

translation.en: -Okay, okay. I'll try, I'll try. -[indistinct chatter]
translation.ja: 分かった　やってみよう

translation.en: I've never tried to be an actor though.
translation.ja: 演技は初めてだ

translation.en: -Don't be an actor. You're a real guy! -[laughs]
translation.ja: そのままでいいですよ

translation.en: [Dan] I guess some people would call me... obsessive, if you want to call it that.
translation.ja: やりすぎだという人もいるだろう

translation.en: You know, I have, like, hundreds of hours of videos and cassette tapes
translation.ja: 膨大な数のビデオとテープがある

translation.en: from wiretapping phone conversations...
translation.ja: 電話の録音テープだ

translation.en: about what happened to me.
translation.ja: 事件の記録だよ

translation.en: [Dan] Let me just tell you something.
translation.ja: いいか

translation.en: It was very inappropriate, the way the police went about doing what they did.
translation.ja: 警察の捜査の仕方は間違っている

translation.en: [man] Well, once again, Mr. Schneider, I resent the implication.
translation.ja: その言い方はないでしょう

translation.en: [Dan] My son was murdered...
translation.ja: 息子は殺された

translation.en: buying crack in the Lower 9th Ward.
translation.ja: コカインを買ってね

translation.en: The police have the attitude that it's another drug deal gone bad.
translation.ja: 警察は麻薬絡みの事件だから―

translation.en: And these kids maybe got what they deserved.
translation.ja: 死んで当然という態度だった

translation.en: [man] You are not going to dictate to me. I'm talking.
translation.ja: 命令される覚えはない 〝セントバーナード郡保安官事務所 〞

translation.en: [woman] You don't talk to people like that who just lost a son. We lost a son.
translation.ja: 〝セントバーナード郡保安官事務所 〞 私たちは息子を殺されたの

translation.en: We just lost a son. He didn't lose a son, okay?
translation.ja: その気持ちが分かる？

translation.en: He didn't lose a son!
translation.ja: 分からないでしょ

translation.en: [Dan] The New Orleans Police Department was corrupt
translation.ja: 警察は腐敗し― 警察は腐敗し― 〝ニューオーリンズ警察 〞

translation.en: and almost none of the murders were ever solved.
translation.ja: どの殺人事件も未解決だった

translation.en: But I was determined to get the killer off the street
translation.ja: しかし私は決めた

translation.en: and if the police wasn't gonna do it, I was gonna do it.
translation.ja: 警察が無理なら私が解決すると

translation.en: [reporter 1] In other news, a St. Bernard family is on a campaign for justice.
translation.ja: 家族は正義のために活動しています

translation.en: [Dan] I wasn't gonna let 'em knock me down.
translation.ja: 負けたくなかった

translation.en: Twenty-three-year-old Danny Schneider was gunned down in his pickup truck.
translation.ja: 23歳のダニーは銃で撃たれました

translation.en: Police say that they have little to go on.
translation.ja: 捜査は進展していません

translation.en: Schneider's parents are grief-stricken.
translation.ja: 両親は失意の日々です

translation.en: [crying] He was a good kid.
translation.ja: いい子だった

translation.en: He didn't deserve this.
translation.ja: 許せません

translation.en: In my fight to get Danny some justice,
translation.ja: ダニーのためであると同時に―

translation.en: I promise I will work hard... to try to save other lives.
translation.ja: 他の子供が犠牲にならないためにも戦います

translation.en: At first, my mission was to get justice for my son.
translation.ja: 最初は息子のためだった

translation.en: But then I started noticing, in the drugstore,
translation.ja: しかし気づいたんだ

translation.en: an unusual amount of high-powered opiate prescriptions.
translation.ja: 薬局には麻薬性鎮痛薬があふれている

translation.en: [reporter 2] Chalmette pharmacist Daniel Schneider says
translation.ja: 薬剤師のシュナイダーは―

translation.en: he's taken a leave of absence from his drugstore job
translation.ja: 薬局を休職しました 〝ブラッドリー薬局 〞

translation.en: to crusade against the illegal use
translation.ja: 鎮痛薬の違法使用に反対するためです

translation.en: of OxyContin.
translation.ja: 鎮痛薬の違法使用に反対するためです〝オキシコドン 〞

translation.en: [Dan] There was a certain doctor using her license
translation.ja: ある医師は立場を利用し―

translation.en: to virtually decimate my community.
translation.ja: 地域を崩壊させた

translation.en: -Not only did I see malpractice... -[pills shake] ...I saw corruption, I saw conspiracy.
translation.ja: 医療過誤というだけでなく腐敗と陰謀だ

translation.en: People were dying every week.
translation.ja: 毎週 人が死んでいる

translation.en: -[cameras clicking] -Eighteen, and 20, and 25-year-old kids.
translation.ja: 18歳から25歳の若者だ

translation.en: I could see my son's face in their face.
translation.ja: 彼らの中に息子を感じる

translation.en: -[sirens wail] -[voice breaking] I couldn't save my son.
translation.ja: 救えなかった息子を

translation.en: But I can save some other kids.
translation.ja: しかし他の子は救える

translation.en: And I'm not gonna let this drug continue to kill.
translation.ja: この薬による死を止めたいんだ

translation.en: I started realizing that there was a bigger mission here.
translation.ja: 大きな使命を感じ始めた

translation.en: OxyContin. It was produced by Purdue Pharma.
translation.ja: 〝オキシコドン 〞 パーデュー社のオキシコドンは― パーデュー社のオキシコドンは― パーデュー社のオキシコドンは― 〝パーデュー 〞

translation.en: -And I saw this opiate epidemic... -[pills rattle]
translation.ja: 〝オキシコドン 〞 発売初期にオピオイド危機を生んだ 発売初期にオピオイド危機を生んだ

translation.en: ...in its infancy.
translation.ja: 発売初期にオピオイド危機を生んだ

translation.en: We were creating addicts all over this country.
translation.ja: 国中に中毒者が出ている

translation.en: Purdue could have done things to stop this,
translation.ja: 〝パーデュー 〞 〝パーデュー 〞 それを止めるべき企業が― それを止めるべき企業が―

translation.en: but they saw the profits.
translation.ja: 利に走った

translation.en: Not only were they white-collar criminals... they were white-collar murderers.
translation.ja: 企業という立場を利用した殺人者だ

translation.en: My son's killer paid a price.
translation.ja: 犯人は捕まった

translation.en: What about Purdue Pharma? What price have they paid?
translation.ja: パーデューはどう償いを？

translation.en: They gave birth to a crisis that killed hundreds of thousands of people.
translation.ja: 何十万という人を死なせたんだ

translation.en: -What price have they paid? -[dramatic instrumentals fade]
translation.ja: どう償いを？

translation.en: [Dan] St. Bernard Parish, it's right next to New Orleans.
translation.ja: セントバーナード郡はニューオーリンズの隣だ

translation.en: We used to call it God's Country.
translation.ja: 昔は神の国と呼ばれた

translation.en: Kind of sandwiched between the Mississippi River and, really, the swamps.
translation.ja: ミシシッピ川と沼地に挟まれている

translation.en: St. Bernard was basically middle-class.
translation.ja: 中産階級が暮らし―

translation.en: We have two major oil refineries,
translation.ja: 石油精製所が２つある

translation.en: and fishermen and crabbing and oystering.
translation.ja: 魚やカニやカキが採れる

translation.en: Somebody's always selling shrimp on the side of the road.
translation.ja: 道でエビも買える

translation.en: My dad used to take us, when we were little, me and my brother...
translation.ja: ダンの妻アニー･シュナイダー ダンの妻アニー･シュナイダー 父はよく言っていた

translation.en: He'd tell us on a Sunday, "We're gonna take a ride to the end of the world."
translation.ja: “世界の終わりまでドライブしよう”と

translation.en: He would drive us down, way down deep into the parish...
translation.ja: 奥地まで車を走らせた

translation.en: past Chalmette, Meraux, Poydras and Violet.
translation.ja: シャルメットを抜け―

translation.en: Way down to the end where Delacroix Island was.
translation.ja: デラクロワ島まで行くの

translation.en: And it was the Gulf of Mexico.
translation.ja: メキシコ湾に出ると―

translation.en: And he'd just say, "Here's the waters."
translation.ja: “海だよ”と言った

translation.en: "Here's the Gulf. This is the end of the world to us."
translation.ja: “世界の終わりだ”と

translation.en: And we always thought that was the end of the world for everybody.
translation.ja: 私たちは本当にそう信じていた

translation.en: [Dan] I started out in football
translation.ja: １９６９年私はアメフトで前衛をしていた

translation.en: as a lineman.
translation.ja: 私はアメフトで前衛をしていた

translation.en: I actually had pretty good hands and I had great speed.
translation.ja: 勘がよく 足が速かった

translation.en: -[sentimental instrumentals] -But I was blind as a bat.
translation.ja: でも視力が弱かった

translation.en: -[whistle blows] -We had a tremendous football season.
translation.ja: すごいシーズンだった

translation.en: When I saw Annie, she was just the cutest thing.
translation.ja: そしてアニーと出会った

translation.en: [Annie] I was a grade lower than him.
translation.ja: 彼は上級生で―

translation.en: I liked his personality.
translation.ja: 人柄にひかれたの

translation.en: [Dan] I don't think I won her over because of my looks, okay?
translation.ja: 顔で射止めたとは思わないが―

translation.en: But we just really fell in love with each other.
translation.ja: 私たちは恋に落ちた

translation.en: [Annie] We got married a couple of years after high school.
translation.ja: 卒業の数年後に結婚した

translation.en: I really didn't know what I wanted to do, to be quite honest with you.
translation.ja: 仕事は何でもよかった

translation.en: A friend of mine talked about the pharmacists having a great job.
translation.ja: 薬剤師はいい仕事と聞いた

translation.en: Didn't have a great interest in it. It's just...
translation.ja: 特に興味はなかったが―

translation.en: I had to pick out something real quick
translation.ja: 仕事が必要だった

translation.en: where I could reach my goals of having kids and having a house.
translation.ja: 家族や家を持ちたかったんだ

translation.en: I became a pharmacist in 1975.
translation.ja: １９７５年私は薬剤師になった 私は薬剤師になった

translation.en: -[cars rushing] -I worked for Bradley's Pharmacy.
translation.ja: いわゆる田舎の薬局で働いていた

translation.en: You might call it a country drugstore.
translation.ja: いわゆる田舎の薬局で働いていた いわゆる田舎の薬局で働いていた〝ブラッドリー薬局 〞

translation.en: I enjoyed being able to interact with the patients,
translation.ja: 〝営業時間 〞 〝営業時間 〞接客は楽しかった 接客は楽しかった 接客は楽しかった〝ブラッドリー薬局 〞

translation.en: being able to actually feel like I was helping 'em.
translation.ja: 〝ブラッドリー薬局 〞役に立っていると思えるから

translation.en: I picked pharmacy and then I... I stuck with it.
translation.ja: そのまま薬剤師を続けた

translation.en: [Dan] Aw, look who had a bath.
translation.ja: 誰がお風呂に入るかな

translation.en: [Annie] We waited five years before we had our first child, Danny.
translation.ja: 結婚して５年目にダニーが生まれた

translation.en: It was wonderful to have a little boy to... play with.
translation.ja: １９７６年子供がいるというのはすばらしいことだ

translation.en: He was a good kid. Gentle and caring. He was just always happy.
translation.ja: 優しく思いやりのある子でいつも楽しそうだった

translation.en: [Dan] Then we had a daughter, Kristi.
translation.ja: クリスティが生まれた クリスティが生まれた１９８０年

translation.en: [Kristi] My family was very, very close, growing up.
translation.ja: とても仲の良い家族だった とても仲の良い家族だった ダンの娘クリスティ･シュナイダー

translation.en: We did all kinds of family vacations together.
translation.ja: ダンの娘クリスティ･シュナイダー よく家族旅行に行ったものよ よく家族旅行に行ったものよ

translation.en: [Dan] There's the old Tin Lizzie.
translation.ja: ティン･リジーだ

translation.en: [Kristi] It was long travels. We would go across country.
translation.ja: 国内を縦断する長い旅だった

translation.en: [Dan] That's the Shenandoah Valley outlook.
translation.ja: シェナンドア川流域だ

translation.en: Here we are out in Alabama. It looks like the Alabama tree.
translation.ja: ここはアラバマだからあれはアラバマの木よ

translation.en: Many people thought we were like the Griswolds.
translation.ja: まるでグリズワルド一家だ

translation.en: [Dan] Here we are. The Griswolds.
translation.ja: 〝チョコレート･ワールド 〞 〝チョコレート･ワールド 〞 グリズワルド一家だぞ グリズワルド一家だぞ

translation.en: [young Kristi] Shut up!
translation.ja: やめて

translation.en: [Annie] We had the same type of car they had.
translation.ja: 映画と車も同じで―

translation.en: Danny was like Chevy Chase.
translation.ja: ダニーも似てた

translation.en: [Dan] Intercourse, Pennsylvania.
translation.ja: 〝インターコース村 〞 インターコース村だ

translation.en: We just seen some Amish people.
translation.ja: アーミッシュがいる

translation.en: -[young Kristi] Amish people. -[hooves clomping]
translation.ja: アーミッシュだ

translation.en: As a matter of fact, when we had Christmas,
translation.ja: クリスマスには―

translation.en: you know, it was like we used to get this big, giant Christmas tree.
translation.ja: 巨大なツリーを飾った

translation.en: A seventeen-foot Christmas tree, we'd have in our house.
translation.ja: 約５メートルのツリーよ

translation.en: It was like Christmas Vacation every Christmas for almost 20 years.
translation.ja: 20年間そんな感じで祝ってた

translation.en: [Kristi] My dad, every year, wanted to get a tree... Like the biggest tree you could get. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 父は毎年大きなツリーを欲しがった

translation.en: -[rustles plastic] -[indistinct chatter]
[Annie] This is 1989.
[Kristi] My friends would come over
translation.ja: １９８９年友達や親戚が来て飾り付ける

translation.en: and relatives would come over and help decorate it.
translation.ja: 友達や親戚が来て飾り付ける

translation.en: So it was like a family tradition.
translation.ja: 家族の伝統行事よ

translation.en: [Annie] Okay, wait a minute.
translation.ja: 待ってね

translation.en: And it just felt like the perfect life.
translation.ja: 理想的な生活よ

translation.en: We didn't want for nothing else. We had everything.
translation.ja: 望むものすべてを持っていた

translation.en: [Annie] The Schneider clan.
translation.ja: シュナイダー一族よ

translation.en: -[Annie] Where are you, son? -[young Danny] Up here.
translation.ja: どこにいるの？ ここだよ ここだよ ダニー･シュナイダー･ジュニア

translation.en: [Annie] Going on the plane from...
translation.ja: ダニー･シュナイダー･ジュニア 飛行機に乗るのは…

translation.en: [Dan] My son was a really good-natured, compassionate kid.
translation.ja: 温厚で心の優しい子だった

translation.en: As he got a little bit older, he really became kind of like a peacenik.
translation.ja: 大きくなっても平和を好む子だった

translation.en: [Kristi] He was very creative. He liked to write poems.
translation.ja: 創造力があり詩を書いていた

translation.en: And a lot of my friends had crushes on Danny and it used to aggravate me.
translation.ja: 友達がダニーに夢中になるのがイヤだった

translation.en: [Dan] Will he make it? Oh, Lord!
translation.ja: いけるか？ 残念

translation.en: -[applause] -Almost!
translation.ja: 惜しいな

translation.en: Danny was a good dad. He was a doting dad.
translation.ja: ダンはいい父親だった ダンはいい父親だった 家族の友人デビー･マリーノ

translation.en: He made sure, you know, the kids had what they needed and wanted.
translation.ja: 家族の友人デビー･マリーノ 家族の友人デビー･マリーノ 子供たちを何不自由なく育てたわ 子供たちを何不自由なく育てたわ

translation.en: [Dan] Later on in life, when I had a few pennies, I really wanted a project with Danny.
translation.ja: 老後にダニーとかなえたい夢があった

translation.en: Danny and I tore apart this Mustang.
translation.ja: マスタングをバラバラにして―

translation.en: Pulled the motor out and worked on, uh, rebuilding the car.
translation.ja: エンジンを取り出し車を組み立てたんだ

translation.en: We would go on long rides with that Mustang. We both loved that car.
translation.ja: 生きていれば長いドライブに行くだろう

translation.en: St. Bernard Parish was right down the street below the Lower 9th Ward.
translation.ja: セントバーナード郡は下９地区のそばだ

translation.en: One day, I took Danny to the Lower 9th Ward,
translation.ja: ルイジアナ州ニューオーリンズ下９地区 ルイジアナ州ニューオーリンズ下９地区ある日ダニーを― ルイジアナ州ニューオーリンズ下９地区 ルイジアナ州ニューオーリンズ下９地区下９地区に連れていった

translation.en: which was in the city.
translation.ja: 下９地区に連れていった

translation.en: And we drove and saw the house that my family came from.
translation.ja: 昔 住んでいた家を見に行ったんだ

translation.en: My family moved out of the 9th Ward during the era of what you might call the "white flight."
translation.ja: ホワイト･フライトで第９地区からは転居した

translation.en: It was racial.
translation.ja: 人種問題だ

translation.en: [man] As a child growing up in the city,
translation.ja: 街が栄えるにつれ―

translation.en: a lot of African-Americans started started buying homes in the Lower 9th Ward
translation.ja: 黒人が下９地区に家を買い始めた

translation.en: and white Americans moved into St. Bernard.
translation.ja: 白人はセントバーナード郡に引っ越していき―

translation.en: And it's like two different worlds.
translation.ja: 世界は二分された

translation.en: At that time, it was a real, in-your-face type of racism.
translation.ja: 〝黒人は引っ越せ 〞 当時はあからさまな差別があった

translation.en: All the time, they would call you a nigger
translation.ja: ニガーと呼ばれたし― ニガーと呼ばれたし― 下９地区牧師テレンス･リード

translation.en: or they would write it on the car or they would write it on something.
translation.ja: 下９地区牧師テレンス･リード 下９地区牧師テレンス･リード 車にいたずら書きもされた 車にいたずら書きもされた

translation.en: That's what we grew up with, you know?
translation.ja: そんな環境で育ったんだ

translation.en: It was basically called a city into a city.
translation.ja: 都市の中の都市と言われていた 下９地区の住民シェーン･マディング

translation.en: [Shane] We used to play softball on the levee.
translation.ja: よくソフトボールをしたわ

translation.en: We would have little penny parties, waistline parties.
translation.ja: ささやかなパーティーもね

translation.en: As they would say, a wing dang doodle,
translation.ja: 騒いで踊っていた

translation.en: when everybody would get together and just basically have fun.
translation.ja: みんなで集まれば楽しかったの

translation.en: But, in the '80s, the neighborhood had...
translation.ja: でも80年代になって周りの様子が―

translation.en: had totally changed.
translation.ja: 変わった

translation.en: [reporter] The housing projects and streets of New Orleans are filled with people who are hooked on crack cocaine.
translation.ja: 街はコカイン中毒者であふれています

translation.en: [Terrence] By that time, the crack epidemic was setting in.
translation.ja: その頃にはクラックの流行が始まってた

translation.en: It just got real bad.
translation.ja: 最悪の状況だ

translation.en: [man 2] I grew up in the Lower 9th Ward.
translation.ja: 俺は下９地区で育った

translation.en: And it was a place...
translation.ja: 言ってみれば そこは―

translation.en: that we considered as hell.
translation.ja: 下９地区の住民ジェフリー･ホール 地獄だよ

translation.en: You see white folks down here, you...
translation.ja: 白人がいたら―

translation.en: "Are you not the police? Or are you looking to score something?"
translation.ja: 警官か ドラッグ目当てだ

translation.en: The neighborhood that I was in, in the 9th Ward, that's all that came around.
translation.ja: 下９地区はそんな場所だった

translation.en: They was all from St. Bernard Parish, you know, coming down to buy drugs.
translation.ja: 白人はみんなドラッグを買いにここに来る

translation.en: [Dan] I had been aware at the time that a number of kids from St. Bernard
translation.ja: 当時セントバーナードの多くの子供が―

translation.en: had gotten shot to death up in the 9th Ward, buying drugs.
translation.ja: ドラッグを買いに行き殺された

translation.en: And, much as I hate to say it...
translation.ja: 悔しいが―

translation.en: I heard about it and read it in the paper and...
translation.ja: 私はそれを知っていた

translation.en: my attitude at that time, and I'm not proud of it, okay, was...
translation.ja: 残念に思うと同時にこう思っていたんだ

translation.en: "Kids shouldn't have been up there."
translation.ja: “行くのが悪い”と

translation.en: [Annie] And now we're going into the Schneider house.
translation.ja: 今から家に入るわ

translation.en: somebody gets stupid and then somebody gets shot.

translation.en: [reporter] The St. Bernard family
translation.ja: 〝第９地区 〞家族は正義のために活動しています 家族は正義のために活動しています 家族は正義のために活動しています〝１９９９年４月 〞 家族は正義のために活動しています

translation.en: is on a campaign for justice.
translation.ja: 家族は正義のために活動しています〝殺人 〞〝家族の訴え 〞

translation.en: [Jeffery] It was just like, "He's got to be crazy.

translation.en: He was that bold. He was that bold. He wanted-- He wanted answers.

translation.ja: 話を聞いて回れば思いを消化できるかと

translation.en: [spokesman] Sad to say, but we haven't really been able
translation.ja: 〝フォーストール通り 〞〝ドーフィネ通り 〞 〝フォーストール通り 〞〝ドーフィネ通り 〞 残念ながら証人が見つかりません

translation.en: to locate anyone who's been willing to come forward
translation.ja: 残念ながら証人が見つかりません 事件を目撃した人も情報提供者も―

translation.en: who may have witnessed the incident
translation.ja: 事件を目撃した人も情報提供者も―

translation.en: or who may have any information regarding the incident.
translation.ja: 見つかりませんでした

translation.en: [Debbie] So many unsolved murders in New Orleans.
translation.ja: 多くの殺人事件が未解決のままだった

translation.en: Because nobody was coming forward.
translation.ja: 証人がいないから

translation.en: What do you do?
translation.ja: どうすれば？

translation.en: What do you do?
translation.ja: 何か方法が？

translation.en: -[Dan] How are you doing? -Good, Danny.
translation.ja: 調子は？ いいわ

translation.en: [Dan] Debbie Marino, good, good friend of ours.
translation.ja: デビーは親しい友人だ

translation.en: She handed me a check for, like, $2,000.
translation.ja: 2000ドルの小切手をくれたよ

translation.en: And other people, family members and friends, put in money.
translation.ja: 他の友人たちもお金を出したわ

translation.en: -The reward fund is up to $10,000. -Ten thousand dollars.
translation.ja: 〝ダニー･シュナイダー 〞報奨金は１万ドルになりました 報奨金は１万ドルになりました 報奨金は１万ドルになりました〝報奨金引き上げ 〞

translation.en: Ten thousand dollars on the table.
translation.ja: 報奨金は１万ドルです情報をお寄せください

translation.en: [reporter 1] Call Crimestoppers at 822-1111.
translation.ja: 報奨金は１万ドルです情報をお寄せください〝クライムストッパーズ 〞 報奨金は１万ドルです情報をお寄せください 報奨金は１万ドルです情報をお寄せください〝殺人事件被害者 〞

translation.en: [Dan] It was explained to me that the person would be anonymous
translation.ja: 〝殺人事件被害者 〞 〝殺人事件被害者 〞匿名でも起訴に協力すれば― 匿名でも起訴に協力すれば―

translation.en: and that only upon indictment would they actually receive their reward.
translation.ja: 報奨金を受け取れるということだった

translation.en: [reporter 1] And a reminder, you do not have to give your name.
translation.ja: 匿名で構いません

translation.en: That's one big concern with the family.
translation.ja: 家族の懸念は―〝フォックス ８キム･ホールデン 〞 〝フォックス ８キム･ホールデン 〞

translation.en: They feel anybody in the neighborhood who may know something is afraid to come forward and tell what they know.
translation.ja: 〝フォックス ８キム･ホールデン 〞情報提供者が申し出をためらうことです

translation.en: When the reward was just at $1,000,  it was just like, "Yeah, okay, that's another murder happened,
translation.ja: 報酬が１０００ドルならまたかという感じで―

translation.en: you know, that ain't gonna get solved."
translation.ja: 解決はないだろう 解決はないだろう〝クライムストッパーズ 〞

translation.en: Well, when $10,000 came up,
translation.ja: しかし１万ドルとなると―〝逮捕や起訴につながる情報を― 〞 〝逮捕や起訴につながる情報を― 〞

translation.en: they had people pulling them flyers down
translation.ja: 〝逮捕や起訴につながる情報を― 〞誰もが情報を提供したがった 誰もが情報を提供したがった 誰もが情報を提供したがった〝提供した方に報奨金１万ドル 〞

translation.en: wanting to talk.
translation.ja: 誰もが情報を提供したがった〝提供した方に報奨金１万ドル 〞

translation.en: [Fanguy] Yes? Sergeant Fanguy.
translation.ja: ファンガイだ

translation.en: [Dan] Thank you, Sergeant. What you got?
translation.ja: 〝ニューオーリンズ警察 〞どうも　何か情報が？

translation.en: [Fanguy] Uh... wanted to let you know
translation.ja: 〝ニューオーリンズ警察 〞 息子さんを撃った犯人が分かった〝第５地区警察署 〞

translation.en: that we found out who the shooter was on your son's case.
translation.ja: 息子さんを撃った犯人が分かった〝第５地区警察署 〞

translation.en: Do we have any witnesses?
translation.ja: 目撃者が？

translation.en: [Fanguy] We do have an eyewitness.
translation.ja: 目撃者がいた

translation.en: [Dan] Okay.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: [Fanguy] The kid has picked his picture out. We're getting ready to take a statement from him.
translation.ja: 彼の供述から容疑者が浮上した

translation.en: Uh, he corroborates a lot of things based on evidence at the scene.
translation.ja: 供述は現場の状況を裏付けるものだ

translation.en: [Dan] And they went out to a young man named Jeffery Hall.
translation.ja: 目撃者の名はジェフリー･ホール

translation.en: He was about 15 years of age.
translation.ja: 15歳の少年だった

translation.en: Apparently, Jeffery saw it all.
translation.ja: すべてを目撃したようだ

translation.en: [Jeffery] They were questioning me about it, you know, and, um...
translation.ja: 事件について聞かれたから―

translation.en: I gave them...
translation.ja: 答えた

translation.en: to the best of my ability, what I could remember.
translation.ja: 覚えてる限りね

translation.en: [Fanguy on tape] This juvenile, that's the witness... -[Dan] Yeah. -...sold drugs to your son before.
translation.ja: 以前ダニーにドラッグを売ったことがあるそうだ

translation.en: -[Dan] Wow. -[Fanguy] He knew your son.
translation.ja: そうか 顔を知ってた

translation.en: He was walking towards your son when he saw him pulling up,
translation.ja: ダニーに近づこうとしたら―

translation.en: but the other boy was standing there first and he approached your son.
translation.ja: 他の少年が先に行ったと言ってる

translation.en: [Dan] Oh, so somebody beat him to it.
translation.ja: 出し抜かれたのか

translation.en: [Dan] So this guy probably wouldn't have blown my son away.
translation.ja: 彼だったら撃たれなかったのに

translation.en: -He would probably have dealt with my son. -[Fanguy] Right. Right.
translation.ja: 彼だったら撃たれなかったのに そうかもしれない

translation.en: And, according to the witness, the guy upped with the pistol
translation.ja: その男が銃を取り出し撃ったと

translation.en: -and shot him. -[Dan] Okay.
translation.ja: その男が銃を取り出し撃ったと そうか

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: Wow.
translation.ja: すごい

translation.en: [Fanguy] So, he just picked the suspect's picture out of a lineup.
translation.ja: 写真を見せて容疑者を特定できた

translation.en: [Dan] And the suspect was a guy named Scarface.
translation.ja: スカーフェイスという名前だった スカーフェイスという名前だった〝スカーフェイス 〞

translation.en: [Jeffery] Scarface was a person in the neighborhood
translation.ja: 〝スカーフェイス 〞スカーフェイスは地元では有名なワルだ

translation.en: who was known for doing bad things.
translation.ja: スカーフェイスは地元では有名なワルだ

translation.en: Jacking, killing, robbing. Just...
translation.ja: 強奪や殺人に手を染めてた

translation.en: Anything bad, Scarface did it.
translation.ja: 何か事件があると彼だった

translation.en: [Fanguy] The way he describes how the shooting took place, he'd have had to been there to see it go down.
translation.ja: 供述内容から現場で目撃したのは間違いない

translation.en: I'm gonna have the warrant put in the computer immediately.
translation.ja: すぐに令状を請求して―

translation.en: He could be arrested in the next 30 minutes.
translation.ja: 30分以内に逮捕する

translation.en: [Dan] Oh, boy.
translation.ja: 信じられない

translation.en: You've taken about a thousand pounds off my back, I think.
translation.ja: 肩の荷が下りた気がするよ

translation.en: [Dan] Well, the next morning, the lieutenant called me and said...
translation.ja: 翌朝 警部補が電話してきた

translation.en: "Mr. Schneider, I'm sorry to say this, but, uh...
translation.ja: 謝罪の電話だった

translation.en: your son's murder isn't solved.
translation.ja: 事件は解決しなかったとね

translation.en: We went out to arrest that killer, but we found out that killer was in jail
translation.ja: 事件当時の夜容疑者は―

translation.en: and he had been in jail the night your son was murdered...
translation.ja: 服役中だったそうだ

translation.en: so he couldn't have been the killer."
translation.ja: 犯人ではなかった

translation.en: The DA told me the case was pretty weak.
translation.ja: 〝ダニーの殺人事件調査テープ 〞検事は望みは薄いと言った

translation.en: Because of all the confusion,
translation.ja: 〝ダニーの殺人事件調査テープ 〞捜査の混乱で― 〝ダニーの殺人事件調査テープ 〞

translation.en: it was gonna be hard to actually charge the case.
translation.ja: 〝ダニーの殺人事件調査テープ 〞起訴が難しくなっていた 起訴が難しくなっていた

translation.en: [Fanguy] I mean, he has made contradictory statements, as I told you.
translation.ja: 供述が矛盾している

translation.en: [Dan] He's really lost a lot of his credibility.
translation.ja: 彼は信用を失った

translation.en: I didn't actually, you know, know the guy. I knew him, but I couldn't point him out.
translation.ja: 男は見たがよく分からなくなったんだ

translation.en: [Dan] You said that you were gonna recommend that the case, at this time, be, uh...
translation.ja: 現時点でこの事件の起訴は…

translation.en: -[Fanguy] Refused. -[Dan] Just refused.
translation.ja: しない なるほど

translation.en: [Fanguy] That the testimony is insufficient to prove this crime.
translation.ja: 立証には証言が不十分だ

translation.en: [Dan] I didn't trust the cops or the DA.
translation.ja: 警察は信じられない

translation.en: I thought that if we could get the DA to re-interview this witness,
translation.ja: 証人がもう一度検事と面談できれば―

translation.en: maybe we could get the story straight and have a case.
translation.ja: 起訴できるかもしれない

translation.en: I said, "I'd like to bring the witness back in.
translation.ja: 証人に会うために―

translation.en: Can you give me his address?"
translation.ja: 住所を聞いた

translation.en: I started reflecting on where he grew up.
translation.ja: 彼の育った環境を考えた

translation.en: And I found out that the conditions he came up in had been really bad.
translation.ja: そして劣悪な環境で育ったと知ったんだ

translation.en: It was a struggle every day, man.
translation.ja: 毎日 苦しかった

translation.en: You know, Mom had a problem... you know, that I didn't understand.
translation.ja: 事情は知らないが母は問題を抱えていた

translation.en: Seeing my mom on drugs was real painful for me.
translation.ja: ドラッグ中毒の母を見るのはつらかった

translation.en: One time, I was 11 years old...
translation.ja: 一度 俺が11歳の時だ

translation.en: I took her drugs and her paraphernalia and I took it and threw it away
translation.ja: 母のドラッグと道具を捨てて―

translation.en: and told her she was gonna get off this stuff.
translation.ja: やめようと言ったんだ

translation.en: And she taught me a lesson.
translation.ja: お仕置きされたよ

translation.en: Turned on the stove.
translation.ja: コンロの火をつけ―

translation.en: She called some people and held me off and held my arm, held my two legs and...
translation.ja: 誰かを呼んで俺の手と足を押さえつけた

translation.en: she took my hand and put it on the fire, like this.
translation.ja: そして俺の手を火の上に置いた

translation.en: And that's what really led me to being affiliated in the streets.
translation.ja: それでワルとつるむようになった

translation.en: Being the age that I was and in that situation I was in...
translation.ja: 小さい時からずっとそんな環境にいて―

translation.en: it was a constant challenge and struggle for me.
translation.ja: 苦しみの連続だった

translation.en: I was scared more than anything.
translation.ja: 何より 怖かった

translation.en: [Annie] Danny was hoping that this young man
translation.ja: ダンは期待していた

translation.en: could actually help us find the killer of our son
translation.ja: 彼の証言で犯人を見つけられるとね

translation.en: and he believed in him.
translation.ja: 信頼していたの

translation.en: [Dan] It's, uh... I think it's July 28th.
translation.ja: １９９９年７月28日の録音 今日は７月28日です

translation.en: I, uh...
translation.ja: どうか―

translation.en: need some help today. Today's an important day
translation.ja: 力をお貸しください

translation.en: [strained] in my fight to get Danny some justice.
translation.ja: ダニーにとって大事な日です

translation.en: Today's the day, God, that Jeffery Hall, who is the witness... [sniffles]
translation.ja: 目撃者のジェフリー･ホールが―

translation.en: The DA's gonna interview him.
translation.ja: 検事と会います

translation.en: [sniffles] I've had a couple conversations with the kid.
translation.ja: ジェフリーと少し話しました

translation.en: He's scared to death. He's scared of the police.
translation.ja: 彼は警察を恐れてる

translation.en: The people on the street. He's afraid he might have to appear in court.
translation.ja: 仲間の手前出廷をためらっています

translation.en: [crying] I need God to get inside him and get the whole truth. God...
translation.ja: 神よ　彼に真実を語らせてください

translation.en: help him get in the car with me today.
translation.ja: 車に乗りますように

translation.en: [sniffles] I need him in court, God. I need the boy to be brave. And I need you to protect him. [sniffles]
translation.ja: 彼に勇気を与えどうか彼をお守りください

translation.en: Please. I know you can't give me my boy back...
translation.ja: 息子はもう帰ってきません

translation.en: on Earth...
translation.ja: この世には

translation.en: but you could have an effect on this young man.
translation.ja: でもこの若者に力をください

translation.en: He was on my front step seeking answers, wanting answers.
translation.ja: ダンは答えを求めて玄関先にいた

translation.en: [Dan] I was already recording a lot of people, so I felt like -that was a great opportunity. -[tape clicks]
translation.ja: 多くの人の話を録音していた

translation.en: And I wired my car... with a recording device...
translation.ja: 車にも配線を引いてトランクに―

translation.en: and put it in the trunk of the car with a wire that went to the back seat.
translation.ja: 録音機器を設置していた

translation.en: I figured that maybe I could get some revealing information.
translation.ja: 新たな情報を期待していたんだ

translation.en: -[mellow instrumentals] -[clicks]
translation.ja: １９９９年７月28日の録音

translation.en: [Dan] It's the corner here. Jeff, you were riding up here?
translation.ja: １９９９年７月28日の録音 ジェフ　この角だな？ ジェフ　この角だな？

translation.en: [Jeffery] Danny and them were right here on this block.
translation.ja: ちょうどここだ

translation.en: So by the time I got down, Danny made the block...
translation.ja: バイクを降りたらダニーが…

translation.en: Scarface, you know, was right here.
translation.ja: スカーフェイスはここにいた

translation.en: [Dan] Scarface, right here?
translation.ja: ここに？

translation.en: Okay, but the first night... This is where I'm confused, because this is what messes up the case.
translation.ja: でも最初の夜は…そこがはっきりしないな

translation.en: They showed him some pictures. He finally picked out somebody that first night.
translation.ja: 君は最初に写真で犯人を特定した

translation.en: -[woman] Mm-hmm. -[Dan] Why did you pick out that guy?
translation.ja: そうだ なぜその男を？

translation.en: [Jeffery] I was just lying, you know.
translation.ja: ウソをついた

translation.en: I just did. I was scared for my life.
translation.ja: 命が惜しかったんだ

translation.en: [Dan] You were scared and you thought that would get you out of it?
translation.ja: 怖くてウソをついたのか？

translation.en: That's the damn problem. The DA can't just disregard that first statement.
translation.ja: それを検事は問題視してる

translation.en: Jeffery, you're gonna have to do your best to let that DA know.
translation.ja: 検事に知らせる必要がある

translation.en: You've got to try to come across truthful to him now...
translation.ja: 正直に伝えるんだ

translation.en: so that it means a little more to him.
translation.ja: そういう姿勢が大事だ

translation.en: You know, in his opinion, you could just be--
translation.ja: 検事は君が…

translation.en: -[woman] Telling him anything. -[Dan] You could be saying anything.
translation.ja: 全部伝えて １回目がウソなら２回目もそう思われる

translation.en: You were lying the first time and you were lying the second time.
translation.ja: １回目がウソなら２回目もそう思われる

translation.en: -[woman] Right. -[Dan] And so...
translation.ja: それから…

translation.en: You just tell the truth.
translation.ja: 真実を言ってくれ

translation.en: There ain't no way they're gonna nail you on this. I'll make damn sure. Okay?
translation.ja: 捕まることはない　大丈夫だ

translation.en: Alright.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: [Dan] The DA re-interviewed him.
translation.ja: 検事は再び尋問した

translation.en: And then, the next day, I talk to the DA and he says, "Look,"
translation.ja: 次の日に結果を聞くと―

translation.en: he says, "It didn't get any better.
translation.ja: ダメだと言われた

translation.en: He contradicts himself."
translation.ja: 話の筋が通らないと

translation.en: "Jeffery Hall is not a credible witness any longer."
translation.ja: ジェフリーは完全に信用を失った

translation.en: "What do I do from here?"
translation.ja: 私はどうすれば？

translation.en: I was told, "You've got to find another witness.
translation.ja: 他の目撃者を見つけないと―

translation.en: You're not gonna get a prosecution unless you get a witness."
translation.ja: 起訴はできない

translation.en: [NOPD officer on tape] It's not a point of going through the motions.
translation.ja: １９９９年７月の録音 こだわるより起訴できるようにすることだ

translation.en: It's a point of making a good case that you can prosecute.
translation.ja: １９９９年７月の録音 こだわるより起訴できるようにすることだ こだわるより起訴できるようにすることだ

translation.en: They're not gonna accept this case unless we produce additional witnesses.
translation.ja: 別の目撃者を見つけないといけない

translation.en: We need a witness or we need evidence.
translation.ja: 目撃者か証拠が必要だ

translation.en: [Dan] I started looking for witnesses.
translation.ja: 街で再び―

translation.en: I was starting to walk the streets again and put posters up.
translation.ja: 〝フォーストール通り 〞〝ドーフィネ通り 〞 〝フォーストール通り 〞〝ドーフィネ通り 〞 目撃者を捜し始めた

translation.en: Some of the drug dealers had put a bounty out on him
translation.ja: 麻薬の売人が報奨金を出して―

translation.en: to stop him from coming in that neighborhood.
translation.ja: ダンを止めようとしていた

translation.en: [Kristi] He wasn't sleeping. He was up constantly, investigating.
translation.ja: 夜も眠らず調査をしていた

translation.en: And I didn't want him to go in the 9th Ward and get killed.
translation.ja: 危険なのでやめてほしかった

translation.en: Then I wouldn't have my dad or my brother.
translation.ja: 父まで失いたくない

translation.en: [Annie] I was scared, you know, all the time.
translation.ja: いつも怖かった

translation.en: "You have me to worry about and you have your daughter to worry about, okay?
translation.ja: “あなたには心配する家族がいる”と伝えた

translation.en: And we're still here, you know?"
translation.ja: “家族でしょ”とね

translation.en: [Fanguy] You need to leave the dust settle right where it's at, right now.
translation.ja: 事件を引っかき回さないほうがいい

translation.en: [Dan] I'm trying to help, but I'm not trying to get in your business, okay?
translation.ja: 捜査を邪魔してるわけじゃない

translation.en: He came to my office and put the recorder on my desk and said, "Listen to this."
translation.ja: 録音機を持ってきて“聞いてくれ”と

translation.en: [chuckles] I say, "You crazy fuck." [laughs]
translation.ja: 私は“異常だ”と言った

translation.en: You know, "We're gonna be scraping you off the street out there."
translation.ja: 好きにさせるわけにはいかない

translation.en: [Dan] I didn't really believe in guns, and so I chose to go up there without a gun.
translation.ja: 銃は嫌いなので丸腰で行った

translation.en: But one of my friends was so concerned about me that he decided to ride with me.
translation.ja: でも友人が心配してついてきてくれた

translation.en: He says, "We'll go up there and you can do your interviewing and you can do your questioning, okay?
translation.ja: “話を聞いて回っている間自分は車で―”

translation.en: And I'll be in the car with a gun."
translation.ja: “銃を持って待ってる”と

translation.en: And we pulled over the car and right next to us was a guy, he's a retired drug dealer.
translation.ja: 車を止めると元売人という男がいて―

translation.en: He asked me the details, he asked me the names of the suspects, you know, what corner it was on and all this.
translation.ja: 容疑者の名前や事件の場所を聞いてきた

translation.en: And he says, "Okay." He says, "I'm pretty sure I can find out which one it is.
translation.ja: すると犯人を見つけられると言うんだ

translation.en: Okay? And verify that... they killed him.
translation.ja: そして“犯人を殺そうか？”と―

translation.en: Do you want me to have him killed?"
translation.ja: 聞かれた

translation.en: I don't know what world I'm in anymore.
translation.ja: 何という世の中だ

translation.en: I really don't know what world I'm in.
translation.ja: ひどい世界だよ

translation.en: [stammers] For a moment... [sobbing] I actually thought about it.
translation.ja: 一瞬だがその考えが頭をよぎった

translation.en: Crazy.
translation.ja: 異常だ

translation.en: But I remembered...
translation.ja: でも神との―

translation.en: [sniffles] I'd promised God that I was gonna do this the right way.
translation.ja: 約束を思い出したんだ

translation.en: I was gonna do it right.
translation.ja: 正しく行動すると

translation.en: It's torturing me!
translation.ja: 拷問のようだ

translation.en: [crying] I can't do it forever. It's tearing me up. It's tearing Mom up.
translation.ja: 私も母さんも心が引き裂かれる

translation.en: I've set sort of a time limit.
translation.ja: 期限を決めた

translation.en: I don't know if I'm gonna wanna stick with that, but...
translation.ja: 続けることもできるが―

translation.en: I can't torture myself forever, Danny. [sniffles]
translation.ja: 永遠には無理だ　ダニー

translation.en: You want to give up, but you can't give up because you're looking for the answer.
translation.ja: 答えを探しているうちは諦めがつかない

translation.en: You're looking to solve the case.
translation.ja: 解決したいが―

translation.en: Which doesn't help that much, because you still lost your son.
translation.ja: 何をしてもお前は帰ってこない

translation.en: [Dan] I asked God...
translation.ja: 神に願った

translation.en: to help me quit.
translation.ja: やめさせてほしいと

translation.en: I was anticipating quitting.
translation.ja: やめようと思った

translation.en: I said, "If I haven't found anything by the end of September...
translation.ja: ９月末までに見つからなければ―

translation.en: I promise I'll give it up."
translation.ja: やめる決意だった

translation.en: There were a lot of things I wanted to do during the course of this investigation.
translation.ja: やりたい調査はたくさんあった

translation.en: What I really wanted to do, is I wanted to call people
translation.ja: 一番は住人に電話をかけることだ 一番は住人に電話をかけることだ 〝情報を得るために住人に電話 〞

translation.en: in the neighborhood.
translation.ja: 一番は住人に電話をかけることだ 〝情報を得るために住人に電話 〞

translation.en: And, at the time, there was something called a Haines Directory.
translation.ja: 当時は分厚い電話帳に―

translation.en: It was a big, thick book and it had all the addresses and phone numbers of everybody in the city,
translation.ja: 住所と電話番号が全部載っていた

translation.en: so I took out a map and I drew a circle...
translation.ja: 地図を取り出し円を描くと―

translation.en: so many blocks each way,
translation.ja: 事件現場を中心として多くの家があった

translation.en: in a circle around the corner where my son was killed,
translation.ja: 事件現場を中心として多くの家があった 事件現場を中心として多くの家があった 〝第９地区 〞

translation.en: Dauphine and Forstall.
translation.ja: 事件現場を中心として多くの家があった 〝第９地区 〞

translation.en: I went home, [sniffles] I sat on my bed...
translation.ja: １９９９年９月１日事件から５ヵ月後自宅に帰りベッドに座って― 自宅に帰りベッドに座って―

translation.en: and I started making phone calls.
translation.ja: 電話をかけ始めた

translation.en: Then when I called, half weren't home.
translation.ja: 半分は留守だった

translation.en: [recording] We're unable to answer your call, -so speak after the beep and we'll... -[beep]
translation.ja: ただいま電話に出られません

translation.en: [automated voice] We're sorry, you have reached a number that has been disconnected or is no longer in service.
translation.ja: この電話は現在使われておりません

translation.en: [woman on phone] Hello?
translation.ja: はい

translation.en: [Dan] Yeah, Miss Smith, this is Dan Schneider.
translation.ja: スミスさんですね

translation.en: You don't know me, but my son was killed on the corner of Dauphine and Forstall a couple of months back in a red pickup truck.
translation.ja: 近所で起きた事件のことでお聞きしたいのです

translation.en: [Annie] Every night, he would sit and call maybe 40 or 50 at a time or something.
translation.ja: 毎晩40～50件ぐらい電話をしていた

translation.en: [Dan] Some of 'em weren't very receptive.
translation.ja: 迷惑そうにされることもあった

translation.en: [man on phone] I be at work too much. I really don't know.
translation.ja: 忙しくてよく知らない

translation.en: [woman] A week later, I heard something about that, but I don't have any idea.
translation.ja: 事件のことは聞いたけど何も知らない

translation.en: [Dan] There was a boy named Scarface arrested for it.
translation.ja: スカーフェイスが逮捕された

translation.en: [woman] A boy named who?
translation.ja: 何て？

translation.en: Somebody might've been out there who saw something.
translation.ja: 何かを見た人がいるかも

translation.en: Uh-uh, not here.
translation.ja: ここにはいない

translation.en: [Dan] A few of 'em were very sympathetic.
translation.ja: 同情的な人もいた

translation.en: [man] I was sorry to hear about it, you know, 'cause, uh...
translation.ja: 悲しい出来事だ

translation.en: -[Dan] Yeah, it's-- -[man] When it happened, you know, I...
translation.ja: 事件が起こった時…

translation.en: I was surprised, you know. I heard the shot.
translation.ja: 事件を聞いて驚いた

translation.en: You hear shots in this neighborhood a lot. -That's the way it is. -[Dan] Yeah.
translation.ja: この地域ではよくあるけどね

translation.en: -[man] It's gotten so bad, you know? -[Dan] Yeah.
translation.ja: 環境が悪くなってるんだ

translation.en: [man] So I'm sorry to hear about your son.
translation.ja: 残念だよ

translation.en: [woman] If I had heard anything, I would've let somebody in authority know,
translation.ja: 何か知ってたら警察に知らせるわ

translation.en: because my son got killed and I know how it feels.
translation.ja: 私の息子も殺されたの

translation.en: -[Dan] Your son got killed? -[woman] My son got killed.
translation.ja: 本当に？ そうよ

translation.en: [Dan] Oh, my Lord.
translation.ja: なんてことだ

translation.en: -[woman] Yeah, he got killed. -[Dan] How long back?
translation.ja: 殺されたの それはいつ？

translation.en: [woman] Uh, two years ago.
translation.ja: ２年前よ

translation.en: -I know how it feels. -[Dan] How old was he?
translation.ja: 当時 何歳だった？

translation.en: [woman] He was 38 years old. He was my baby son.
translation.ja: 38歳で大事な息子だった

translation.en: My heart goes out to you 'cause I've been through it and I know how it feels.
translation.ja: だから気持ちは分かるわ

translation.en: It's something I'll never get over as long as I live.
translation.ja: 生きてる限り悲しみは消えない

translation.en: [Dan] I think it was my last call for the day, at the end of the list.
translation.ja: それはその日最後の電話だった

translation.en: [Shane] Hello?
translation.ja: １９９９年９月１日の電話 １９９９年９月１日の電話 はい

translation.en: -[Dan] Yeah, Ms. Madding? -Uh-huh.
translation.ja: １９９９年９月１日の電話 １９９９年９月１日の電話 マディングさん？ １９９９年９月１日の電話 ええ

translation.en: [Dan] You don't know me, but, uh, my name's Dan Schneider
translation.ja: 初めましてシュナイダーです

translation.en: and my son was killed down the street from you on the corner of Dauphine and Forstall.
translation.ja: 息子の事件について聞きたい

translation.en: Now how did he know my number?
translation.ja: なぜ私の番号を？

translation.en: My heart started beating faster on that one.
translation.ja: 〝マディング 〞びっくりしたわ びっくりしたわ

translation.en: And I couldn't believe he had actually... called the right house.
translation.ja: まさに探してた家に電話をしたのよ

translation.en: [Dan] You were the first one to call 911.
translation.ja: あなたが最初に通報を？

translation.en: [Shane] Uh-huh. I just called them and told them someone had been shot...
translation.ja: ええ　誰かが撃たれたと通報したわ

translation.en: in a red truck.
translation.ja: 赤い車のね

translation.en: [Dan] I couldn't believe it.
translation.ja: 耳を疑ったよ

translation.en: She said, "I saw the whole thing.
translation.ja: 彼女は“全部見てた”と

translation.en: I saw it all.
translation.ja: すべて見て―

translation.en: I called Crimestoppers."
translation.ja: 通報したと

translation.en: [Shane] I called them twice to find out if they hadn't gotten the person and stuff.
translation.ja: 何か役に立つかと二度 電話したわ

translation.en: [scoffs] I called my wife.
translation.ja: 妻を呼んだ

translation.en: I said, "I've got something!" [sobs]
translation.ja: “見つけた”と叫んだんだ

translation.en: [strained] "I've really got something. I've got a chance.
translation.ja: “望みが出たから―”

translation.en: I can't quit."
translation.ja: “やめない”と

translation.en: And I sat down and... I told him what I knew.
translation.ja: 知っていることはすべて話した

translation.en: On that night...
translation.ja: その夜―

translation.en: I was standing in front of my mom's house. Me and a guy friend.
translation.ja: 友達と母の家の前に立っていたの

translation.en: I looked to the corner, because I saw headlights, and I seen a little red truck.
translation.ja: 角を見ると赤いトラックが見えた

translation.en: And as the red truck passed us, I could see it was a white guy.
translation.ja: 通り過ぎる時白人が目に入った

translation.en: I knew he was young.
translation.ja: 若者だった

translation.en: Your son had the window down.
translation.ja: 窓を開けてたわ

translation.en: -[Dan] My son had the window down? -[Shane] Yeah.
translation.ja: 窓を？ ええ

translation.en: [Dan] And then you seen... Tell me what happened then. He passed you up, drove down the street.
translation.ja: 通り過ぎてその後どうなったんだ？

translation.en: [Shane] I saw the dealer flag him down.
translation.ja: 売人が手を振り車を止め―

translation.en: And then they went back round the block and they came back again.
translation.ja: 乗り込むと 車が走り出した

translation.en: And before they could get to Dauphine Street, by the pool, I saw the car stop. I saw them brake.
translation.ja: そしてドーフィネ通りに入る前に止まったわ

translation.en: And they stopped on Dauphine and Forstall.
translation.ja: ドーフィネ通りとフォーストール通りの角よ

translation.en: I saw the dealer get out of the truck and run to the driver's side.
translation.ja: 売人がトラックから降りて運転席に走り寄った

translation.en: The red truck jacked, like he was trying to get away.
translation.ja: トラックは逃げようとしていた

translation.en: And there was a "pow."
translation.ja: そして銃声が

translation.en: [Shane] I looked up and I heard a pop and saw the fire from the gun.
translation.ja: 銃が火をふくのを見たし銃声も聞きました

translation.en: And all I know is I heard one shot. Everybody says he was shot twice.
translation.ja: みんなは銃声は２回だと言ったけど―

translation.en: I say that boy was shot one time.
translation.ja: 私は１回だと思う

translation.en: -I wouldn't go down there to look. -[Dan] Right.
translation.ja: 確認はしてない そうか

translation.en: [Shane] All I could see down the street was the truck had come to a halt.
translation.ja: 私が見たのはトラックが停止して―

translation.en: It was like, you know, slanted on the sidewalk in front of the street.
translation.ja: 歩道に乗り上げ傾いてるところだった

translation.en: After that, I just saw the shooter running
translation.ja: その後 犯人は走って逃げて―

translation.en: and he threw the gun in the drain.
translation.ja: 銃を排水溝に捨てた

translation.en: [Dan] And you even seen his shirt and all? His white shirt?
translation.ja: シャツは白いシャツ？

translation.en: [Shane] Mm-hmm. It had splattered blood on it.
translation.ja: 血が飛び散ってた

translation.en: [Dan] It had splattered blood on it.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: I saw the killer.
translation.ja: 私が犯人を見ると―

translation.en: He saw me.
translation.ja: 彼も私を見た

translation.en: [Shane] Well, see, I could put my hand on the Bible and I swear to God... God loves the truth.
translation.ja: 神に誓って言ってるのこれが真実よ

translation.en: Scarface wasn't the killer.
translation.ja: 犯人はスカーフェイスじゃない

translation.en: Jeffery was.
translation.ja: ジェフリーよ

translation.en: [Shane] It was Jeffery.
translation.ja: ジェフリーよ

translation.en: [Dan] That can't be... [stammers] I mean...
translation.ja: そんな…　信じられない

translation.en: I'll be darned.
translation.ja: なんてことだ

translation.en: [Shane] Jeffery was the killer.
translation.ja: 犯人はジェフリーよ

translation.en: [Dan] I mean, I'd heard-- The police said it could have been Jeffery,
translation.ja: 警察は“ジェフリーかもしれない”と

translation.en: but, you know, I did meet with Jeffery.
translation.ja: 私は彼に会ったんだ

translation.en: -I hate to say it, but I believed Jeffery. -[Shane scoffs]
translation.ja: しかも信頼してた

translation.en: [Dan] Jeffery said he knew my son
translation.ja: 息子の知り合いなのに

translation.en: -and he wouldn't have killed my son. -[Shane] What?
translation.ja: 息子の知り合いなのに 本当？

translation.en: [Dan] That's right. That's what Jeffery told me.
translation.ja: ジェフリーが言ってた

translation.en: He said he was kind of a friend with my son. He'd sold my son drugs a couple of times, but that he wouldn't...
translation.ja: 息子に何度かドラッグを売ったことがあるとね

translation.en: He wouldn't have hurt Danny.
translation.ja: それなのに…

translation.en: You never did see Jeffery on his bike?
translation.ja: ジェフリーはバイクに？

translation.en: [Shane] No.
translation.ja: いいえ

translation.en: [Dan] You did see him in my son's truck and get out and walk around the back?
translation.ja: 息子のトラックから降りて回り込んだと？

translation.en: -[Shane] That's right, and shot him. -[gun fires]
translation.ja: ええ　そして撃った

translation.en: [Dan] And shot him?
translation.ja: 撃った？

translation.en: [Shane] And shot him.
translation.ja: そうよ

translation.en: [Shane] After Daniel's murder, Jeffery came back.
translation.ja: ダニーを撃った後彼は戻ってきた

translation.en: 'Cause he saw us standing out there.
translation.ja: 私たちを見たからよ

translation.en: He said... "Titi, you see what I did?"
translation.ja: “ティティ　撃ったのを見てたか？”と聞かれた

translation.en: [Shane] He said, "Titi, look what I've done."
translation.ja: “ティティ　見てたか？”と

translation.en: -[Dan] What he calls you? -[Shane] "Titi."
translation.ja: 何て？ ティティ

translation.en: -[Dan] Titi? -[Shane] Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: ティティ？

translation.en: Jeffery was my best friend's son.
translation.ja: ジェフリーは親友の息子だった

translation.en: I was always "Auntie," or "Tidi," or "Titi," um, to her kids.
translation.ja: 彼女の子供たちは私をティティと呼んでた

translation.en: Jeffery was the oldest.
translation.ja: ジェフリーは一番上の子で―

translation.en: His mom had... ten more children.
translation.ja: 兄弟は他に10人もいたの

translation.en: I guess between drugs and babies...
translation.ja: 彼女はドラッグや子育ての忙しさで―

translation.en: you know, she didn't focus.
translation.ja: 上の空だったのね

translation.en: [Dan] Did Jeffery ever mention to you... why he shot my son?
translation.ja: ジェフリーはどんな理由で息子を撃ったと？

translation.en: Did he just... lose his mind and do it?
translation.ja: 頭に血が上って撃った？

translation.en: What provoked it?
translation.ja: 理由は？

translation.en: [Shane] He didn't lose his mind. Peer pressure.
translation.ja: 何もない　仲間の手前よ

translation.en: [Dan] Peer pressure?
translation.ja: 仲間の手前？　誰かが…

translation.en: -Maybe somebody told him-- -[Shane] That's all.
translation.ja: 仲間の手前？　誰かが… それだけよ

translation.en: [Dan] Maybe that was his assignment that day,
translation.ja: その日 誰かを殺そうと思ってた？

translation.en: to kill somebody.
translation.ja: その日 誰かを殺そうと思ってた？ 〝ジェフリー･ホール車で 〞

translation.en: This is the corner right here. Jeff, you were riding here?
translation.ja: 〝ジェフリー･ホール車で 〞 ジェフ　この角だな？ 〝ジェフリー･ホール車で 〞

translation.en: [Jeffery] Danny and them were right here on this block.
translation.ja: 〝ジェフリー･ホール車で 〞 ちょうどここだ ちょうどここだ

translation.en: [Dan] Not only did I find out that Jeffery was the killer...
translation.ja: 犯人が判明しただけでなく―

translation.en: but he had betrayed me. He had lied to me.
translation.ja: ジェフリーの裏切りを知った

translation.en: It sounds petty, but that almost bothered me as much.
translation.ja: ささいなことだが相当ショックだった

translation.en: I trusted him.
translation.ja: 信じていたんだ

translation.en: He was gonna help me.
translation.ja: 助けてくれると

translation.en: And he was the killer.
translation.ja: でも犯人だった

translation.en: How could this thing get so screwed up?
translation.ja: なぜこんなことに？

translation.en: [Jack] Crimestoppers gets information on a suspect.
translation.ja: ４ヵ月前容疑者の情報は入っていた 容疑者の情報は入っていた

translation.en: NOPD goes to the suspect.
translation.ja: 警察が行くと―

translation.en: He immediately says it was some other guy,
translation.ja: 犯人は別だと言う 犯人は別だと言う〝スカーフェイスと呼ばれてる 〞 〝スカーフェイスと呼ばれてる 〞

translation.en: who he probably thinks the police are gonna like more than him.
translation.ja: 〝スカーフェイスと呼ばれてる 〞彼より可能性がありそうな男だった

translation.en: So the whole thing starts to get really, really convoluted then,
translation.ja: 〝バイクに乗ってた時話してるのを見た 〞 〝バイクに乗ってた時話してるのを見た 〞それで現場が混乱していった 〝バイクに乗ってた時話してるのを見た 〞

translation.en: because now he goes from the suspect to a potential witness.
translation.ja: 〝バイクに乗ってた時話してるのを見た 〞容疑者が目撃者になったのだから 容疑者が目撃者になったのだから 容疑者が目撃者になったのだから〝３メートルぐらい先で銃声を聞いた 〞

translation.en: [Dan] I was later told you never make a suspect a witness.
translation.ja: 容疑者が目撃者になることはあり得ないが―

translation.en: And that's what they immediately did.
translation.ja: 警察はやらかした

translation.en: "Police 101," they call it.
translation.ja: 初歩的なミスだ

translation.en: They should have went in the house, looked for a gun.
translation.ja: 銃を捜索すべきだったし―

translation.en: They should have looked for blood on the tennis shoes, clothing that had blood on it, blood splatter.
translation.ja: 血の付いた靴やシャツを探すべきだった

translation.en: They didn't do any of that.
translation.ja: 何一つしてない

translation.en: [Shane] But I need y'all to promise me that they'll never know it's me that's giving out this information.
translation.ja: 情報を提供したのは私だと警察に言わないで

translation.en: -[Dan] I understand. Look-- -[Shane] I don't want my name mentioned.
translation.ja: 分かってる 匿名よ それは必ず守る君の名前は言わない

translation.en: [Dan] I'm with you on that. And I am not gonna mention your name.
translation.ja: それは必ず守る君の名前は言わない

translation.en: I don't want to put you in jeopardy, but I would like a little help,
translation.ja: 危険にさらすつもりはないが少し助けてほしい

translation.en: 'cause, apparently, they're not having much luck. These cops ain't the sharpest guys in the world.
translation.ja: 鈍い警官ばかりで解決できそうにないんだ

translation.en: The fear had really set in after that call.
translation.ja: 電話の後で怖くなったの

translation.en: I knew if he could walk the blocks...
translation.ja: ダンが近所に来たら…

translation.en: and if he could call me on the phone...
translation.ja: ダンが電話をかけてきたら…

translation.en: they were gonna find out it was me.
translation.ja: 私だとバレる

translation.en: If those guys find out that you was a witness,
translation.ja: 証人になったとバレたら―

translation.en: then they're gonna come and threaten you or threaten your family members,
translation.ja: 家族も含めて脅される

translation.en: to let them know that, "If you do testify, we're gonna kill everybody."
translation.ja: “証言したら全員殺すぞ”と

translation.en: [Shane] I didn't know how it was gonna happen.
translation.ja: 安易に考えていたけど―

translation.en: I just knew in my heart something was gonna happen to me.
translation.ja: 心では何か起こると感じていたみたい

translation.en: [Shane] Yeah, I have nightmares...
translation.ja: 悪夢を見るの

translation.en: -[Dan] Right. -[Shane] ...thinking of, you know, what my outcome...
translation.ja: 証言することの結果を考えるとね

translation.en: What might happen to me, what my children...
translation.ja: 私に何かあったら子供はどうなるの？

translation.en: Who's gonna raise my children? My mama and my dad's already sick.
translation.ja: 私に何かあったら子供はどうなるの？ 父は具合が悪いし母は心臓病よ

translation.en: My mama has heart trouble.
translation.ja: 父は具合が悪いし母は心臓病よ

translation.en: -[Dan] Right. -[Shane] It's a lot to think about.
translation.ja: そうか 心配なの

translation.en: [Dan] I don't want to give you danger.
translation.ja: 危険にさらしたくない

translation.en: You might be the only person that can help solve this case.
translation.ja: 君が唯一の望みなんだ

translation.en: So I fear for you too.
translation.ja: 私も心配してる

translation.en: I fear for you not only personally... I don't want to see you harmed.
translation.ja: 絶対に無事でいてほしい

translation.en: But I also fear that if something happened to you,
translation.ja: もし君に何かあれば―

translation.en: there is no case.
translation.ja: 解決できない

translation.en: I knew I was gonna have an uphill battle.
translation.ja: 無理は承知だった

translation.en: [Shane] Hello?
translation.ja: もしもし

translation.en: -[Dan] Yeah, Shane? -[Shane] Uh-huh.
translation.ja: シェーン？

translation.en: [Dan] This is Mr. Schneider. How are you?
translation.ja: シュナイダーだ

translation.en: [Shane] All right.
translation.ja: ええ

translation.en: -[Shane] Hello? -[Dan] Yeah, Shane?
translation.ja: はい シェーン？

translation.en: -[Shane] Yeah. -[Dan] It's Danny.
translation.ja: ええ 元気か？

translation.en: [Shane] I'm outside with company.
translation.ja: 外にいるの

translation.en: -[Dan] Are you? -[Shane] Yeah.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: -[Dan] You want me to call another time? -[Shane] Yeah, call me about 9:30.
translation.ja: 後にしようか？ ９時30分にかけて

translation.en: [Dan] Call you about 9:30.
